member.name: P:Telerik.RadRotatorUtils.RadControl.UseEmbeddedScripts
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use the embedded JavaScript files or not.
member.value: True if embedded JavaScript files are to be used; otherwise false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: Use this property for debugging purposes or to apply any modifications to the JavaScript files.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadRotator.CustomTransitionFilter
member.summary: Specifies a custom transition effect that overrides the default filter strings used when the TransitionEffect property is set. Use the CustomTransitionFilter propery to fine-tune the DXTransform filters to your liking.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadRotator.FrameTimeout
member.summary: Specifies the frame timeout in ms.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadRotator.FramesToShow
member.summary: Specifies how many frames are visible in the rotator.

summary.para: Specifies the duration of a scroll in ms. The measured time interval is the pause between two sequential scrolls.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadRotator.ScrollDirection
member.summary: Specifies the direction for the scroller.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadRotator.TransitionType
member.summary: Specifies the type of transition. Could be set to either Scroll or Slideshow.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadRotator.TransitionEffect
member.summary: Specifies the transition effect for the slideshow mode.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadRotator.UseSmoothScroll
member.summary: Specifies whether the will use a smoothscroll effect when in Scroll mode.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadRotator.UseRandomSlide
member.summary: Specifies whether will display a random slide when in Slideshow mode.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadRotator.Height
member.summary: Specifies the height of the instance.
member.remarks: The RadRotator control has a default size of 100px (height) and 300px (width). If you don't set the height and width properties they will persist their defualt values. Having a default value in pixels provides a work-around to a well known Internet Explorer issue that DXTransform effects fails for objects that have relative or no size.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadRotator.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the instance.
member.remarks: The RadRotator control has a default size of 100px (height) and 300px (width). If you don't set the height and width properties they will persist their defualt values. Having a default value in pixels provides a work-around to a well known Internet Explorer issue that DXTransform effects fails for objects that have relative or no size.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadRotator.SmoothScrollDelay
member.summary: Specifies a delay for the smoothscroll effect of the instance.

member.name: T:Telerik.WebControls.RadTicker
member.summary: RadTicker v2.1

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTicker.AutoStart
member.summary: Specifies whether the ticker begins ticking automatically.
member.remarks: You should leave this set to false if you are using the ticker within a RadRotator If you use the ticker independently and leave this setting to false you should use the client API call ticker_id.StartTicker() to start it.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTicker.AutoAdvance
member.summary: Specifies whether will begin ticking the next tickerline (if any) after it has finished ticking the current one.
member.remarks: If you set the AutoAdvance property to false, then you will have to use a client API Call ticker_id.TickNextLine()

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTicker.Loop
member.summary: Specifies whether will repeat the first tickerline after displaying the last one.
member.remarks: If you set this property to true RadTicker will never finish ticking. This may have possible implications when having more than one instance in a . They way works is that when the first ticker on a frame has finished ticking it will start ticking the next ticker on the frame. If a instance is ticking (has Loop=true) it will never finish and the next ticker on the frame will not get started.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTicker.TickSpeed
member.summary: Specifies the duration in milliseconds between ticking each character of a tickerline. The lower the value the faster a line will finish ticking.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTicker.LineDuration
member.summary: Specifies in milliseconds the pause makes before starting to tick the next line (if AutoAdvance=True).

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTicker.CssClass
member.summary: The CSS Class name applied to the ticker.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTicker.UserTickerLines
member.summary: Allows the user to add tickerlines programmatically.
